A pub, typically one in the country, in some cases providing accommodation

A light brown shade resembling the color of tanned leather.
The absolute principle underlying the universe, combining within itself the principles of yin and yang and signifying the way, or code of behaviour, that is in harmony with the natural order

A dark, thick flammable liquid distilled from wood or coal, consisting of a mixture of hydrocarbons, resins, alcohols, and other compounds. it is used in road-making and for coating and preserving timber

A unit of weight equal to 2,240 lb avoirdupois (1016.05 kg)
An area in which animals, especially wild animals, are kept so that people can go and look at them

A piece of music in an opera sung by one person
An increase in the amount of something, especially in wealth or weight
A person's manner of walking
A small two-winged fly that resembles a mosquito

Small loose particles of stone or sand

A genre of film or literature characterized by bleakness, moral ambiguity, and crime.
Twelve o'clock in the middle of the day, or about that time

The condensed moisture of the atmosphere falling visibly in separate drops
An act of speaking or complaining about something in a loud and/or angry way

Short for nitroglycerine

A part of an organism which is typically self-contained and has a specific vital function
The quantitative relation between two amounts showing the number of times one value contains or is contained within the other

A conception of or belief about something
The beginning or cause of something

The act of deciding, or the decision that has been taken about, what particular use an area should have
